snippet: The vice president said he hoped to “rebuild trust” with President Dilma Rousseff, who was angered by reports that the N.S.A. had spied on her.
abstract: Vice Pres Joseph R Biden Jr arrives in Brazil, seeking an opening during World Cup soccer tournament to thaw relations with country, which soured after revelations of National Security Agency's surveillance practices; makes it clear ahead of meeting with Pres Dilma Rousseff that Obama administration is hoping to discuss range of issues.
lead_paragraph: The vice president said he hoped to “rebuild trust” with President Dilma Rousseff, who was angered by reports that the N.S.A. had spied on her.

headline.main: Diplomacy and Soccer for Biden in Brazil
headline.print_headline: Diplomacy and Soccer for Biden in Brazil
